newsitem.title: UK: Halifax to have tender of shares on Tuesday.
newsitem.headline: Halifax to have tender of shares on Tuesday.

text.p: Britain's Halifax Plc, formerly a building society until it assumed banking status on flotation on June 2, said it would make another tender of shares on Tuesday.
Halifax said it would make an announcement of the supply of shares to be sold at 1500 hours (1400 GMT) on Tuesday.

Bids in the tender will be accepted up to 1800 hours (1700 GMT) from institutions and London Stock Exchange members who have pre-registered with the Halifax Bookbuilding centres at Merrill Lynch International and Cazenove & Co.
Halifax handed free shares to 7.6 million members many of whom cashed in the stocks immediately.
It had received an average price of 757.3 pence per share when it sold 6.7 million shares in its last tender.
